prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)

Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Iris:
If it's alright with you... I would like you to have this.

Phoenix:
But this is your hood...
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

the fire starting and going out.

Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12

Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.

Evidence 14

Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. Click here for details.
Evidence 16

Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17

Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19

Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night I was helping an acolyte with her training in the Inner Temple. But...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, as you can see, my back likes to act up. Violently.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I left Iris to help the acolyte, and returned to Hazakura Temple.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: There's no bath at the Inner Temple, you see, and I needed a long, hot soak.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was after I had finished, just as I was heading back... that's when I saw it!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To determine the contradiction between the evidence and the testimony, let's examine the relevant pieces closely.

Testimony 3 by Bikini states: "Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner." This suggests that Iris was wearing the same clothes continuously throughout the events leading to the Inner Temple.

Now, let's look at the evidence:

Evidence 6, Iris's Hood, indicates that Iris gave her hood to Phoenix before lights out: 

**Iris:**
"If it's alright with you... I would like you to have this."

**Phoenix:**
"But this is your hood..."

This suggests that Iris was not wearing the hood when Bikini claims to have seen her "dressed exactly as she had been at dinner," thereby indicating that Bikini's account of Iris's attire is inaccurate or contradicts the event described in Iris's Hood.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between Bikini claiming Iris looked exactly as she did during dinner (Testimony 3) and the fact that Iris wasn't, in fact, wearing her hood after she supposedly gave it to Phoenix (Evidence 6).

{"evidence": 6, "testimony": 3}

Person: Bikini

Testimony: I've never seen so much blood before...
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Testimony 5 by Bikini states she witnessed someone she referred to as "Mystic Ami" stabbing Elise through the back. However, according to Elise's Autopsy Report (Evidence 11), Elise Deauxnim died from a stab in the back but fell 10 feet after death. The testimony seems to conflict with the idea that Bikini saw the stab wound being inflicted since it's unlikely she could know the exact moment of the stabbing if Elise's body moved significantly after death. Furthermore, the autopsy report suggests Elise was stabbed from behind rather than in front.

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 5}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To identify the contradiction between the evidence and the testimonies, we can focus on the Weather Data (Evidence 7) and Bikini's testimonies regarding the use of a snowmobile. Bikini's statements suggest that a snowmobile was used to traverse the snowy area between Hazakura Temple and Dusky Bridge, specifically indicating tracks in the snow. However, the Weather Data notes that it snowed until 10:50 PM on the night of the crime, which would have covered any tracks made before then with fresh snow. Thus, the fact that Bikini saw tracks (Testimony 2) contradicts the evidence of continued snowfall.

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 2}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To find the contradiction, we need to reconcile the testimonies with the timeline and evidence. According to the Weather Data (Evidence 7), the lightning, which struck Dusky Bridge, happened between 10:00 and 11:00 PM, specifically at 10:45 PM. The fire started from this lightning strike. Larry Butz testifies that he saw Dusky Bridge on fire after a white flash almost blinded him (Testimony 1 and 2) and that there was still thunder when he went to check it out (Testimony 3). This aligns well as the fire would have started shortly after the lightning strike.

Looking at the testimonies:
- Testimony 1 states Butz was blinded by a white flash.
- Testimony 3 claims there was still thunder, but he went to check out the fire right away.
- According to the Weather Data, the lightning struck at 10:45 PM, and the bridge was on fire after that.

The testimony by Butz (Testimony 3) that he went to check the fire when it was still thundering contradicts the evidence that the snow stopped around 10:50 PM, and it was not thundering after he went to check it out since the lightning was only noted from 10 to 11 PM with the last lightning strike at 10:45 PM. 

Additionally, Phoenix Wright's statement in Evidence 7 indicates he arrived at the courtyard at 11:06 PM, after the murder happened and the snow stopped, which suggests Larry's perception of events doesn’t align with the weather timeline and the situational timeline set by other evidence.

Therefore, the contradiction is:
- Larry's statement (Testimony 3) that there was still thunder when he went to check it.
- The Weather Data (Evidence 7) shows that lightning stopped before 11 PM and thus, by the time Larry claims to have gone to check the fire, it should have quieted.

Here is the answer in JSON format:
{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 3}

response:
To identify a contradiction between the evidence and the testimonies, consider the testimonies by Larry Butz regarding what he allegedly saw and sketched the night of the crime. Specifically, Testimony 3 mentions the shock and awe that Butz felt and transferred directly onto the page. Thus, Testimony 3 about effectively capturing his shock and awe directly contradicts Evidence 15, Larry's Sketch.
